name: fortinet-fortisiem_dev
label: Fortinet FortiSIEM
description: FortiSIEM provides integrations that allow you to query and make changes to the CMDB, query events, and send incident notifications. Provide actions like get incidents, comment incident, cleared incident, get device details, get monitored organizations, report related actions and get all associated events for an incident from FortiSIEM.

fields.title: Server URL
fields.description: URL of the FortiSIEM server to which you will connect and perform automated operations.
fields.name: server

fields.title: Username
fields.description: Username used to access the FortiSIEM server to which you will connect and perform the automated operations.
fields.name: username

fields.title: Password
fields.description: Password used to access the FortiSIEM server to which you will connect and perform the automated operations.
fields.name: password

fields.title: Organization
fields.description: Name of Organization that you will access on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server to perform the automated operations.
fields.name: organization

fields.title: Verify SSL
fields.name: verify_ssl
fields.description: Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified or not.By default, this option is set as True.

operations.title: List Incidents
operations.description: Retrieves a list and details of incidents from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server based on the search criteria you have specified.

parameters.title: From
parameters.name: timeFrom
parameters.tooltip: Specify the start datetime to retrieves the incidents from Fortinet FortiSIEM server.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the start datetime to retrieves the incidents from Fortinet FortiSIEM server.

parameters.title: To
parameters.name: timeTo
parameters.tooltip: Specify the end datetime to retrieves the incidents from Fortinet FortiSIEM server.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the end datetime to retrieves the incidents from Fortinet FortiSIEM server.

parameters.title: Incident Status
parameters.name: incidentStatus
parameters.description: Filter incidents based on Incident status

parameters.title: Incident Category
parameters.name: incidentCategory
parameters.tooltip: Retrieve the incidents records for specified incident category
parameters.description: (Optional) Retrieve the incidents records for specified incident category

parameters.title: Incident Sub Category
parameters.name: incidentSubCategory
parameters.tooltip: Retrieve the incidents records for specified incident sub category
parameters.description: (Optional) Retrieve the incidents records for specified incident sub category

parameters.title: Incident Severity
parameters.tooltip: Severity of the incident that you want to retrieve incident records
parameters.name: severity
parameters.description: (Optional) Severity of the incident that you want to retrieve incident records. You can choose from the following options: High, Medium, Low or you can select more than one.

parameters.title: Event Type
parameters.name: eventType
parameters.tooltip: Retrieve the incidents records for specified event type
parameters.description: (Optional) Retrieve the incidents records for specified event type

parameters.title: Other Filters
parameters.tooltip: Enter parameters based on which you wants to filter the response.e.g. {"status": [0], "eventType": ["PH_RULE_SERVER_CPU_WARN"], "incidentRptIp": ["10.7.12.156"]}
parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Enter parameters based on which you wants to filter the response.e.g. {"status": [0], "eventType": ["PH_RULE_SERVER_CPU_WARN"], "incidentRptIp": ["10.7.12.156"]}

parameters.title: Number Of Items To Return In Response
parameters.name: size
parameters.tooltip: Helps in limiting response to a specified number of incidents
parameters.description: (Optional) Maximum number of incidents that you want this operation to return in the response. By default, the page size is set to 500 items.

parameters.title: Offset
parameters.name: start
parameters.tooltip: Helpful if you want to get a subset of events, say events starting from the 10th event
parameters.description: (Optional)Index of the first item to be returned by this operation. This parameter is useful if you want to get a subset of records, say incidents starting from the 10th incident. By default, this is set as 0.

parameters.title: Order By
parameters.tooltip: Helps in arranging response in ASC or DEC order, based on field choice. Note: this field must be in the list of fields
parameters.description: (Optional) Field using which you want to sort the search results for the report that you want to run on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server. You can also specify the sort direction of the specified field. For example, incidentLastSeen DESC
parameters.name: orderBy

parameters.title: Event Fields To Show In Response
parameters.tooltip: Allows you to manage the response by selecting which fields are to be shown
parameters.placeholder: e.g. eventSeverityCat, incidentLastSeen, incidentFirstSeen, incidentSrc, incidentTarget, incidentRptDevName
parameters.description: Fields that you want to display in the response for the report that you want to run on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.
parameters.name: fields

operations.title: Get Incident Details
operations.description: Get details of an incident from Fortinet FortiSIEM server based on the incident IDs you have specified.

parameters.title: Incident IDs
parameters.tooltip: Incident IDs to get its details(CSV or List format)
parameters.name: incidentId
parameters.description: ID of the incident to get details from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.

operations.title: Update Incident
operations.description: Update attributes of specific incident on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server based on inputs you have specified.

parameters.title: Incident ID
parameters.tooltip: ID of the incident which you wants to update
parameters.name: incidentId
parameters.description: ID of the incident to update on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.

parameters.title: Comment Text
parameters.tooltip: Any comments
parameters.name: comments
parameters.description: Text of the comment that you want to add to the specified incident on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.

parameters.title: Incident Status
parameters.name: incidentStatus
parameters.description: Incident status to update

parameters.title: Incident Severity
parameters.name: severity
parameters.description: Severity that you want to set for the specified incident on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server. You can choose from the following options: HIGH, MEDIUM, or LOW.

parameters.title: Incident Resolution
parameters.name: resolution
parameters.description: Resolution that you want to set for the specified incident on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server. You can choose between True Positive or False Positive

parameters.title: External Ticket Type
parameters.name: externalTicketType
parameters.description: External ticket type to update

parameters.title: External Ticket ID
parameters.name: externalTicketId
parameters.description: External ticket ID to update

parameters.title: External Ticket State
parameters.name: externalTicketState
parameters.description: External ticket state to update

parameters.title: External Assigned User
parameters.name: externalAssignedUser
parameters.description: External Assigned User to update

operations.title: Comment Incident
operations.description: Adds a comment to a specific incident on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server based on the incident ID you have specified.

parameters.title: Incident ID
parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the incident in which you want to add the comment on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.

parameters.title: Comment Text
parameters.name: comment_text
parameters.description: Text of the comment that you want to add to the specified incident on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.

operations.title: Clear Incident With Reason
operations.description: Clears an incident with the reason you have specified on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server based on the incident ID you have specified.

parameters.title: Incident ID
parameters.name: id
parameters.tooltip: Provide incident ID to clear
parameters.description: ID of the incident that you want to clear from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.

parameters.title: Reason
parameters.name: comment_text
parameters.description: Text of the reason that you want to provide which clearing the specified incident from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.

operations.title: Get Events For Incident
operations.description: Retrieves all associated events for a specified incident from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server based on the incident ID you have specified.

parameters.title: Incident ID
parameters.name: incident_id
parameters.description: ID of the incident for which you want to retrieves all events for specified incident from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.

parameters.title: Number Of Items To Return In Response
parameters.name: perPage
parameters.tooltip: Helps in limiting response to a specified number of events
parameters.description: (Optional) Maximum number of events that you want this operation to return in the response. By default, the page size is set to 10 items.

operations.title: Search Events
operations.description: Searches for events in the Fortinet FortiSIEM server based on search attributes and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Search Attributes
parameters.tooltip: Select one or multiple search attributes to prepare your search query
parameters.description: Select attribute types based on which you want to search events
parameters.name: attribute

Destination Port.title: Destination Port IN
Destination Port.tooltip: Comma separated port numbers to search
Destination Port.name: destination_port_value
Destination Port.description: Enter value for attribute Destination Port

Destination IP.title: Destination IP IN
Destination IP.tooltip: Comma separated IP addresses to search
Destination IP.name: destination_ip_value
Destination IP.description: Enter value for attribute Destination IP

Event ID.title: Event ID IN
Event ID.name: event_id_value
Event ID.tooltip: Comma separated event IDs to search
Event ID.description: Enter value for attribute Event ID

Event Action.title: Event Action =
Event Action.name: event_action_value
Event Action.description: Enter value for attribute Event Action

Incident ID.title: Incident ID IN
Incident ID.tooltip: Comma separated incident ID values to search events
Incident ID.name: incident_id_value
Incident ID.description: Enter value for attribute Incident ID

File Name.title: File Name CONTAINS
File Name.tooltip: File name or part of file name to filter events
File Name.name: file_name_value
File Name.description: Enter value for attribute File Name

Host Name.title: Host Name CONTAINS
Host Name.tooltip: Host name or part of host name to filter events
Host Name.name: host_name_value
Host Name.description: Enter value for attribute Host Name

Organization Name.title: Organization Name CONTAINS
Organization Name.tooltip: Organization name or part of Organization name to filter events
Organization Name.name: organization_name_value
Organization Name.description: Enter value for attribute Organization Name

Process Name.title: Process Name CONTAINS
Process Name.tooltip: Process name or part of Process name to filter events
Process Name.name: process_name_value
Process Name.description: Enter value for attribute Process Name

Post-NAT Source IP.title: Post-NAT Source IP IN
Post-NAT Source IP.tooltip: comma separated values of Post-NAT Source IP to filter events
Post-NAT Source IP.name: process_nat_source_ip_value
Post-NAT Source IP.description: Enter value for attribute Post-NAT Source IP

Raw Event Log.title: Raw Event Log CONTAINS
Raw Event Log.tooltip: Enter text to search into raw event logs
Raw Event Log.name: raw_event_log_value
Raw Event Log.description: Enter value for attribute Raw Event Log

Relay IP.title: Relay IP IN
Relay IP.tooltip: comma separated values of Relay IP to filter events
Relay IP.name: relay_ip_value
Relay IP.description: Enter value for attribute Relay IP

Reporting IP.title: Reporting IP IN
Reporting IP.tooltip: comma separated values of Reporting IP to filter events
Reporting IP.name: reporting_ip_value
Reporting IP.description: Enter value for attribute Reporting IP

Source IP.title: Source IP IN
Source IP.tooltip: comma separated values of Source IP to filter events
Source IP.name: source_ip_value
Source IP.description: Enter value for attribute Source IP

Source Port.title: Source Port IN
Source Port.tooltip: comma separated values of Source Port to filter events
Source Port.name: source_port_value
Source Port.description: Enter value for attribute Source Port

Source MAC.title: Source MAC CONTAINS
Source MAC.tooltip: Enter source mac value or part of source mac value to filter events
Source MAC.name: source_mac_value
Source MAC.description: Enter value for attribute Source MAC

User.title: User CONTAINS
User.tooltip: Enter user name or part of user name to filter events
User.name: user_value

parameters.title: Event Fields To Show In Response
parameters.tooltip: Allows you to manage the response by selecting which event fields are to be shown
parameters.description: Fields that you want to display in the report summary for the report that you want to run on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.
parameters.name: select_clause

parameters.title: Time Range
parameters.name: time_selection
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the time duration for which you want to search for reports that you want to run on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server. By default, this is set as Relative Time. If you select Absolute Time, then you must specify the time range, for which you want to search for reports that you want to run on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server, in the From and To fields using the calendar tool. If you select Relative Time, then you have to specify the time duration for which you want to search for reports that you want to run on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server. For example, if you choose Hours from the Relative Time drop-down list and provide the value 2 in the Last field, then this operation searches for reports that are created in the last 2 hours on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.

Relative Time.title: Relative Time
Relative Time.tooltip: For example, if you choose Hours and provide the value 2, then this operation run report for last 2 hours, and return the response against the report from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.
Relative Time.name: rel_time
Relative Time.description: (Optional) Specify the time range for which you want to run report for the specified time span. For example, if you choose Hours and provide 2 in the value, then this operation run report for last 2 hours, and return the response against the report from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.

Absolute Time.title: From
Absolute Time.name: from
Absolute Time.tooltip: Provide the start datetime to get events
Absolute Time.description: (Optional) Specify the start datetime for which you want to get events on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.

Absolute Time.title: To
Absolute Time.name: to
Absolute Time.tooltip: Provide the end datetime to run report
Absolute Time.description: (Optional) Specify the end datetime for which you want to get events on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.

parameters.title: Number Of Items To Return In Response
parameters.name: perPage
parameters.tooltip: Helps in limiting response to a specified number of events
parameters.description: Number of objects that you want this operation to return in the response. By default, the page size is set to 50 items.

parameters.title: Offset
parameters.name: start
parameters.tooltip: Helpful if you want to get a subset of events, say events starting from the 10th event
parameters.description: Helpful if you want to get a subset of events, say events starting from the 10th event. By default, this is set as 0.

operations.title: Get Event Details
operations.description: Get details of specific event on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server based on the event ID you have specified.

parameters.title: Event ID
parameters.name: event_id
parameters.description: ID of the event to get its details from Fortinet FortiSIEM server.

parameters.title: From
parameters.name: from
parameters.tooltip: Provide the start time to find input id from this time
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the start datetime from which you to find event

parameters.title: To
parameters.name: to
parameters.tooltip: Provide the end time to search event till this time
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the end datetime to search event till this time

operations.title: Get All Devices
operations.description: Retrieves a short description for all devices that are configured on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.

parameters.title: Organization
parameters.tooltip: Filter devices based on input organization
parameters.description: Name of the organization for which you want to filter the devices from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.
parameters.name: org

operations.title: Get All Devices For Specified IP Address Range
operations.description: Retrieves a short description for devices that are configured on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server, based on the IP address range that you have specified.

parameters.title: Include IP SET
parameters.tooltip: Provide value in CSV format or provide range e.g 192.168.20.1-192.168.20.100
parameters.description: Value of IP addresses based on which you want for retrieve device information from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server. You must provide the value of this field as a range or in the csv format. For example, 192.168.20.1-192.168.20.100.
parameters.name: includeIps

parameters.title: Exclude IP SET
parameters.tooltip: Provide value in CSV format or provide range e.g 192.168.20.1-192.168.20.100
parameters.description: (Optional) Value of the range of IP addresses that you want to exclude from this search operation. You must provide the value of this field as a range or in the csv format. For example, 192.168.20.1-192.168.20.100.
parameters.name: excludeIps

parameters.title: Organization
parameters.tooltip: Filter devices based on input organization
parameters.description: Name of the organization for which you want to retrieve details of the device from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.
parameters.name: org

operations.title: Get Device Information
operations.description: Retrieves details of a specific device that is configured on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server, based on the Device IP that you have specified.

parameters.title: Device IP
parameters.description: IP address of the device for which you want to retrieve details from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.
parameters.name: ip

parameters.title: Organization
parameters.tooltip: Get device information based on input organization
parameters.description: Name of the organization for which you want to retrieve details of the device from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.
parameters.name: org

operations.title: List Monitored Devices and Attributes
operations.description: Retrieves a list and attributes of all monitored devices that are configured on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.

operations.title: List Monitored Organizations
operations.description: Retrieves a list of all monitored organizations that are configured on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.

operations.title: Get Organization Details
operations.description: Retrieves the details of an organization based on the organization ID that you have specified from Fortinet FortiSIEM server.

parameters.title: Organization ID
parameters.description: ID of the organization for which you want to retrieve details from Fortinet FortiSIEM server.
parameters.name: domain_id

operations.title: Run Advanced Search Query
operations.description: Runs an advanced search query on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server, based on the search conditions and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Advanced Search Query
parameters.tooltip: Form a custom search query using event attributes and logical conditions. You can get the exact event attribute names by running the 'Get Event Attributes' action
parameters.description: Conditions based on which you want to process the search results for the report that you want to run on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server. For Eg: (incidentDetail CONTAIN "jobName"  AND  phEventCategory = 1) AND (phCustId IN (1))
parameters.name: cond

parameters.title: Event Fields To Show In Response
parameters.tooltip: Allows you to manage the response by selecting which event fields are to be shown
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of event fields that you want to display in the report summary for the report that you want to run on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.
parameters.name: AttrList

parameters.title: Group By
parameters.tooltip: Helps in arranging identical data into groups. Gives response as Count
parameters.description: (Optional) Attribute based on which you want to group the search results for the report that you want to run on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server. For Eg: reptDevIpAddr
parameters.name: groupby

parameters.title: Order By
parameters.tooltip: Helps in arranging response in ASC or DEC order, based on field choice
parameters.description: (Optional) Field using which you want to sort the search results for the report that you want to run on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server. You can also specify the sort direction of the specified field. For example, phRecvTime DESC
parameters.name: orderby

parameters.title: Time Range
parameters.name: time_selection
parameters.description: Optional) Specify the time for which you want to search for reports on the Fortinet FortiSIEM server. By default, this is set as Relative Time. If you select Absolute Time, then you must specify the time range, for which you want to search for reports from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server, in the From and To fields using the calendar tool. If you select Relative Time, then you have to specify the time duration based on which you want to search for reports from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.

Relative Time.title: Relative Time
Relative Time.tooltip: For example, if you choose Hours and provide the value 2, then this operation run report for last 2 hours, and return the response against the report from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.
Relative Time.name: rel_time
Relative Time.description: (Optional) Specify the time range for which you want to run report for the specified time span. For example, if you choose Hours and provide 2 in the value, then this operation run report for last 2 hours, and return the response against the report from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.

Absolute Time.title: From
Absolute Time.name: from
Absolute Time.tooltip: Provide the start datetime to run report
Absolute Time.description: (Optional) Specify the start datetime for which you want to run report in the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.

Absolute Time.title: To
Absolute Time.name: to
Absolute Time.tooltip: Provide the end datetime to run report
Absolute Time.description: (Optional) Specify the end datetime for which you want to run report in the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.

parameters.title: Number Of Items To Return In Response
parameters.name: perPage
parameters.tooltip: Helps in limiting response to a specified number of events
parameters.description: (Optional) Maximum number of events that you want this operation to return in the response. By default, the page size is set to 50 items.

parameters.title: Offset
parameters.name: start
parameters.tooltip: Helpful if you want to get a subset of events, say events starting from the 10th event
parameters.description: (Optional)Index of the first item to be returned by this operation. This parameter is useful if you want to get a subset of events, say events starting from the 10th event. By default, this is set as 0.

operations.title: Get Event Attributes
operations.description: Retrieves all event attributes from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.

operations.title: Get Events Data By Query ID
operations.description: Retrieves data for events or incidents from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server based on the executed query ID you have specified.

parameters.title: Query ID
parameters.name: query_id
parameters.tooltip: ID of the executed query to get more data
parameters.description: ID of the executed query based on which you want to retrieve data of events from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server. You can retrieve the Query ID from the output of actions such as 'List Incidents', 'Search Query', etc. .

parameters.title: Number Of Items To Return In Response
parameters.name: perPage
parameters.tooltip: Helps in limiting response to a specified number of events
parameters.description: (Optional) Maximum number of items that you want this operation to return in the response. By default, the page size is set to 50 items.

parameters.title: Offset
parameters.name: start
parameters.tooltip: Helpful if you want to get a subset of events, say events starting from the 10th event
parameters.description: (Optional)Index of the first item to be returned by this operation. This parameter is useful if you want to get a subset of records, say incidents starting from the 10th incident. By default, this is set as 0.

operations.title: Create Watch List
operations.description: Creates a watch list in the FortiSIEM database. A watch list can contain one or more watch list entries

parameters.title: Watch List JSON Object
parameters.name: json_object
parameters.tooltip: JSON Object of Watch list with watch list entry. e.g {"description":"Servers, network","displayName":"Resource Issues","type":"DyWatchList","dataCreationType":"USER","valueType":"STRING","ageOut":"1d","custId":1,"entries":[{"inclusive":true,"entryValue":"PVVol","ageOut":"1d","triggeringRules":"Datastore Space Warning","dataCreationType":"USER"}]}
parameters.description: JSON Object of a watch list with a watch list entry that you want to create in the FortiSIEM database e.g {'description': 'Servers, network or storage devices','displayName': 'Resource Issues Test4','type': 'DyWatchList','isCaseSensitive': false,'dataCreationType': 'USER','topGroup': false,'valuePattern': null,'valueType': 'STRING','ageOut': '1d','custId': 1,'entries': [{'inclusive': true,'entryValue': 'PVVol_A001_A000356_5new','ageOut': '1d','count': 1,'custId': 1,'firstSeen': 1612901760000,'lastSeen': 1612901760000,'triggeringRules': 'Datastore Space Warning','dataCreationType': 'USER'}]}.  Where displayName and type are the required fields.

operations.title: Get Watch Lists
operations.description: Retrieves details for all watch lists or for specific watch lists based on input parameters you have specified.

conditional_output_schema.condition: {{(get_watch_list_by === 'Get All Watch Lists' || get_watch_list_by === 'By Watch List ID' || get_watch_list_by === 'By Watch List Entry Value')}}

parameters.title: Get Watch List Data By
parameters.name: get_watch_list_by

By Watch List ID.title: Watch List ID
By Watch List ID.name: watch_list_id
By Watch List ID.tooltip: Watch list id of a specific watch list.
By Watch List ID.description: Watch list id of a specific watch list.

By Watch List Entry Value.title: Entry Value
By Watch List Entry Value.name: entryValue
By Watch List Entry Value.tooltip: Entry value of watch list entry.
By Watch List Entry Value.description: Entry value of watch list entry.

By Watch List Entry ID.title: Watch List Entry ID
By Watch List Entry ID.name: watch_list_entry_id
By Watch List Entry ID.tooltip: Watch list entry id to get watch list data
By Watch List Entry ID.description: Retrieves a specific watch list which contains a watch list entry with given entry ID

parameters.description: Get watch list data based on input parameters you have provided

operations.title: Get Watch List Entries Count
operations.description: Returns the count of all watch list entries from all watch lists in Fortinet FortiSIEM.

operations.title: Get Watch List Entry
operations.description: Retrieves the specific watch list entry from Fortinet FortiSIEMfor based on the watch list entry ID you have specified.

parameters.title: Watch List Entry ID
parameters.name: watch_list_entry_id
parameters.tooltip: Retrieves a specific watch list entry for given entry ID.
parameters.description: Retrieves a specific watch list entry for  given entry ID.

operations.title: Add Watch List Entries to Watch List
operations.description: Adds watch list entries to one or more watch lists based on watch list ID and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Watch List ID
parameters.name: watch_list_id
parameters.tooltip: ID of the watch list to which you want to add watch list entries.
parameters.description: ID of the watch list to which you want to add watch list entries.

parameters.title: Other parameters
parameters.name: other_params
parameters.tooltip: JSON Array of Watch list entry objects.e.g { "inclusive": false, "count": 10, "custId": 1, "triggeringRules": "Datastore Space Warning", "entryValue": "PVVol_A001_A000356_POWER2", "ageOut": "1d", "lastSeen": 1613601369215, "firstSeen": 1613601369215, "disableAgeout": false, "dataCreationType": "USER"}
parameters.description: JSON Array of watch list entry objects that you want to add to specific watch list groups. e.g { "inclusive": false, "count": 10, "custId": 1, "triggeringRules": "Datastore Space Warning", "entryValue": "PVVol_A001_A000356_POWER2", "ageOut": "1d", "lastSeen": 1613601369215, "firstSeen": 1613601369215, "disableAgeout": false, "dataCreationType": "USER"}

operations.title: Update Watch List Entry
operations.description: Updates a watch list entry in the FortiSIEM database based on watch list entry ID and other input parameters you have provided

parameters.title: Watch List Entry ID
parameters.name: watch_list_entry_id
parameters.tooltip: Watch list entry ID to update watch list entry
parameters.description: The ID of the watch list entry that you want to update in the FortiSIEM database.

parameters.title: Count
parameters.name: count
parameters.tooltip: Specify the occurrence count of the watch list entry
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the occurrence count of the watch list entry that you want to update in the FortiSIEM database.

parameters.title: Last Seen Time
parameters.name: lastSeenTime
parameters.tooltip: The value of the last seen time, i.e.,Timestamp in milliseconds, of the specific watch list
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the value of the last seen time, i.e., the Unix timestamp, of the specific watch list that you want to update in the FortiSIEM database.

parameters.title: State
parameters.name: state
parameters.tooltip: Set specific entry to Active/Inactive state.
parameters.description: Set specific entry to Active/Inactive state.

parameters.title: Other Parameters
parameters.name: other_params
parameters.tooltip: JSON Object of Watch list which you wants to update
parameters.description: JSON Object of a watch list that you want to update in the FortiSIEM database. e.g {'lastSeen': 1612901760002,'dataCreationType': 'USER','firstSeen': 1612901760001,'count': 100,'custId': 1'triggeringRules': 'Datastore Space Warning','description': 'Testing again','id': 889400,'inclusive': true,'entryValue': 'PVVol_A001_A000356_POWER23','expiredTime': 1612988160001,'ageOut': '2d',}.

operations.title: Delete Watch List Entry
operations.description: Deletes watch list entries from the FortiSIEM database based on the ID of the watch list entries you have specified

parameters.title: Watch List Entry IDs
parameters.name: watch_list_entry_ids
parameters.tooltip: Watch List Entry ids to delete in CSV or list format
parameters.description: IDs of the watch list entries, in the CSV or list format, that you want to delete from the FortiSIEM database. For example,  [500000, 500001]

operations.title: Delete Watch List
operations.description: Deletes watch lists from the FortiSIEM database based on the ID of the watch lists you have specified

parameters.title: Watch List IDs
parameters.name: watch_list_ids
parameters.tooltip: Watch list ids to delete in CSV or list format
parameters.description: IDs of the watch lists, in the CSV or list format, that you want to delete from the FortiSIEM database. For example,  [500000, 500001]

operations.title: Create Lookup Table
operations.description: Creates the definition of a lookupTable in the FortiSIEM server based on the name, column list, and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Name
parameters.name: name
parameters.tooltip: The lookup table name.Table name should contain Only letters and numbers allowed
parameters.description:
Specify the name of the lookup table that you want to create in FortiSIEM. 
Note:The table name must contain only alphabets and numbers

parameters.title: Column List
parameters.name: columnList
parameters.tooltip: The list of column definitions of the lookup table. for each column need 3 values. key, Name and type. e.g.[{"key": true, "name": "url", "type": "STRING"}]
parameters.description:
Specify the list of column definitions for the lookup table you want to create in FortiSIEM.For each column you must specify the following three values:  

key - key indicating whether or not the column is a primary column 

name- name of the column 

type - type of the column, which can be STRING, LONG, or DOUBLE. 
For example, 
[ 
{"key": true, "name": "url", "type": "STRING"}, 
 {"key": false, "name": "wfCategoryID", "type": "LONG"} 
]

parameters.title: Description
parameters.name: description
parameters.tooltip: Description of the lookup table.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the description of the lookup table that you want to create in FortiSIEM.

parameters.title: Organization Name
parameters.name: organizationName
parameters.tooltip: The organization name. The default value is the current user organization.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the organization name to be assigned to the lookup table that you want to create in FortiSIEM. By default, this is set to the organization of the current user.

operations.title: Get All Lookup Table
operations.description: Retrieves the list of all lookupTable definitions from the FortiSIEM server based on the input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Offset
parameters.name: stat
parameters.tooltip: Helpful if you want to get a subset of items, say items starting from the 10th place
parameters.description: (Optional) Index of the first item to be returned by this operation. This parameter is useful if you want to get a subset of records, say lookup table definitions starting from the 10th position. By default, this is set as 0.

parameters.title: Number Of Items To Return
parameters.name: size
parameters.tooltip: Number of items to retrieve. Default is 25, maximum is 1000.
parameters.description: (Optional) The maximum number of items that you want this operation to return in the response. By default, the page size is set to 25 items, and the maximum is set at 1000.

operations.title: Delete Lookup Table
operations.description: Deletes the lookupTable definition from the FortiSIEM server based on the lookup table ID you have specified.

parameters.title: Lookup Table ID
parameters.name: lookupTableId
parameters.tooltip: Unique identifier representing the lookup Table.
parameters.description: Specify the unique identifier representing the lookup Table whose definitions you want to delete from the FortiSIEM server.

operations.title: Import Lookup Table Data
operations.description: Imports the data of a specific CSV file in FortiSOAR to a specific lookup table in FortiSIEM based on the File/Attachment IRI, lookup table ID, and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.name: input
parameters.title: File IRI/Attachment ID
parameters.description: Select the method using which you want to import CSV file present in FortiSOAR to the FortiSIEM lookup table. You can choose between Attachment ID and File IRI.

Attachment ID.name: file
Attachment ID.title: Attachment ID
Attachment ID.tooltip: Attachment ID of the csv file that you want to import into lookup table
Attachment ID.description: Specify the Attachment ID of the CSV file that you want to import into the specified lookup table in FortiSIEM

File IRI.name: file
File IRI.title: File IRI
File IRI.tooltip: File IRI of the csv file that you want to import into lookup table
File IRI.description: Specify the CSV file that you want to import into the specified lookup table in FortiSIEM

parameters.title: Lookup Table ID
parameters.name: lookupTableId
parameters.tooltip: Unique identifier representing the lookup Table.
parameters.description: Specify the unique identifier representing the lookup table in FortiSIEM into which you want to import the CSV file in FortiSIEM.

parameters.title: Mapping
parameters.name: mapping
parameters.tooltip: The configuration matches the position of columns in the CSV file to columns in lookup Table. Format as below: {"<LookupTable_Column_Name_1>":<Position_1>,"<LookupTable_Column_Name_2>":<Position_2>}
parameters.description:
Specify the configuration that matches the position of columns in the CSV file to columns in the specified lookup table. The format of the mapping is as follows: {"":,"":} 
For example,{"url":1, "wfCategoryID":2}

parameters.title: File Separator
parameters.name: fileSeparator
parameters.tooltip: The csv file separator. Default is the comma character(,)
parameters.description: Specify the file separator for the specified CSV file. By default, this is set as the comma character(,)

parameters.title: File Quote Char
parameters.name: fileQuoteChar
parameters.tooltip: The csv file quote character. Default is the double quotation character(")
parameters.description: Specify the file quote character for the specified CSV file. By default, this is set as the double quotation character(")

parameters.title: Skip Header
parameters.name: skipHeader
parameters.tooltip: Whether to ignore the csv file header. Default is false.
parameters.description: Select this option to ignore the header of the specified CSV file.

parameters.title: Update Type
parameters.name: updateType
parameters.tooltip: Data update type. Either Overwrite or Append. Default is Overwrite.
parameters.description: Select the method of updating the data in FortiSIEM. You can choose between Overwrite (default) or Append.

operations.title: Check Import Task Status
operations.description: Checks the status of the import lookup table data task in FortiSIEM based on the lookup table ID and task ID you have specified.

parameters.title: Lookup Table ID
parameters.name: lookupTableId
parameters.tooltip: Unique identifier representing the lookup Table.
parameters.description: Specify the unique identifier representing the lookup table in FortiSIEM for which you want to check the import task status.

parameters.title: Task ID
parameters.name: taskId
parameters.tooltip: The task id of the importing data to the lookup Table. It is retrieved from the response of Import Lookup Table Data action
parameters.description: Specify the task id of the importing data to the specified lookup table. You can retrieve the task ID from the response of the 'Import Lookup Table Data' action.

operations.title: Get Lookup Table Data
operations.description: Retrieves items of the specified lookup table from FortiSIEM based on the lookup table ID and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Lookup Table ID
parameters.name: lookupTableId
parameters.tooltip: Unique identifier representing the lookup Table.
parameters.description: Specify the unique identifier representing the lookup table for which you want to retrieve items from FortiSIEM.

parameters.title: Start
parameters.name: start
parameters.tooltip: Index of the first item to be returned by this operation
parameters.description: (Optional) Index of the first item to be returned by this operation. This parameter is useful if you want to get a subset of records, say lookup table items starting from the 10th position. By default, this is set as 0.

parameters.title: Number Of Items To Return
parameters.name: size
parameters.tooltip: Number of items to retrieve. Default is 25, maximum is 1000.
parameters.description: (Optional) The maximum number of items that you want this operation to return in the response. By default, the page size is set to 25 items, and the maximum is set at 1000.

parameters.title: Search Text
parameters.name: searchText
parameters.tooltip: Specify the Search text using which you want to filter items of the specified lookup table
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the Search text using which you want to filter items of the specified lookup table in FortiSIEM.

parameters.title: Sort By
parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.tooltip: Sorted by one of lookupTable columns with descending order. Format:<ColumnName><A blank space><ACS or DESC>
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the lookup table columns using which you want to sort the search results retrieved from FortiSIEM. You can also specify the sort direction of the specified lookup table columns, i.e, descending (DESC) or ascending (ASC).

operations.title: Update Lookup Table Data
operations.description: Updates items of a specified lookup table based on the lookup table ID, key, column data, and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Lookup Table ID
parameters.name: lookupTableId
parameters.tooltip: Unique identifier representing the lookup Table.
parameters.description: Specify the unique identifier representing the lookup table whose items you want to update in FortiSIEM.

parameters.title: Key
parameters.name: key
parameters.tooltip: The primary key of item column and its value. Format: {<keyColumn_1>:<value>} e.g key={"url":"http://example.com"}
parameters.description:
Specify the primary key of the item column and its value that you want to update in the specified lookup table. The format is <keyColumn_1>:<value> 
For example, key={"url":"http://example.com"}

parameters.title: Column Data
parameters.name: columnData
parameters.tooltip: Specify the dictionary of column values you want to update
parameters.description:
Specify the dictionary of column values you want to update in the specified lookup table. 
For example, {"url": "www.test.com", "wfCategoryID": 30, "score": 0.50119}

operations.title: Delete Lookup Table Data
operations.description: Delete items of the specified lookup table in FortiSIEM based on the lookup table ID and primary keys you have specified.

parameters.title: Lookup Table ID
parameters.name: lookupTableId
parameters.tooltip: Unique identifier representing the lookup Table.
parameters.description: Specify the unique identifier representing the lookup table whose items you want to delete in FortiSIEM.

parameters.title: Primary Keys
parameters.name: keys_data
parameters.tooltip: The list of primary key of items column and its values. Format:[ {<keyColumn_1>:<value>, {keyColumn_2}: <value2>}]

operations.title: Get All Resource Lists
operations.description: Retrieves a list of all resources from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.

operations.title: Get Resource List Entries
operations.description: Retrieves a list of elements that belong to a specific resource list in FortiSIEM based on the resource group ID, resource type, and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Resource Group ID
parameters.name: resource_id
parameters.tooltip: Enter Resource Group ID, use action 'Get All Resource Lists' to find group IDs
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the resource group from which you want to retrieve the specific element types. You can use the 'Get All Resource Lists' operation to find the IDs of the resource groups.

parameters.title: Resource Type
parameters.name: resource_type
parameters.tooltip: Select Resource type to get elements from that resource
parameters.description: Select the type of resource (element) that you want to retrieve from the specified resource group in the Fortinet FortiSIEM server. You can choose from the following options: Malware IP, Malware Domains, Malware Urls, Malware Hash, or Malware Processes.

parameters.title: Offset
parameters.name: start
parameters.tooltip: Helpful if you want to get a subset of response
parameters.description: (Optional) Index of the first item to be returned by this operation. This parameter is useful if you want to get a subset of records, say incidents starting from the 10th incident. By default, this is set as 0.

parameters.title: Number Of Items To Return In Response
parameters.name: limit
parameters.tooltip: Helps in limiting response to a specified number of items
parameters.description:
(Optional) The maximum number of entries that you want this operation to return in the response. 
By default, the page size is set to 100 entries.

operations.title: Add Entries To Resource List
operations.description: Adds new elements to a specific resource list in FortiSIEM based on the resource group ID, resource data, and resource type you have specified

parameters.title: Resource Group ID
parameters.name: resource_id
parameters.tooltip: Enter Resource Group ID, use action 'Get All Resource Lists' to find group IDs
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the resource group to which you want to add the specified element. You can use the 'Get All Resource Lists' operation to find the IDs of the resource groups.

parameters.title: Resource Data
parameters.name: resource_data
parameters.tooltip: Enter Resource data into key value pair. e.g {"singleIp": "3.3.3.3","name": "3.3.3.3", "malwareType": "ip", "highIp": "3.3.3.3", "lowIp": "3.3.3.3"}
parameters.description:
Specify the resource (element) data in a key-value pair that you want to add to the specified resource group in the Fortinet FortiSIEM server. For example, 
{ 
  "singleIp": "3.3.3.3", 
  "enableDateFound": false, 
  "enableLastSeen": false, 
  "dateFound": null, 
  "lastSeen": null, 
  "name": "3.3.3.3", 
  "malwareType": "ip", 
  "severity": "low", 
  "highIp": "3.3.3.3", 
  "lowIp": "3.3.3.3", 
  "sysDefined": false, 
  "active": true, 
  "groupId": 15732450304 
}

parameters.title: Resource Type
parameters.name: resource_type
parameters.tooltip: Enter Resource type
parameters.description: Select the type of resource (element) that you want to add to the specified resource group in the Fortinet FortiSIEM server. You can choose from the following options: Malware IP, Malware Domains, Malware Urls, Malware Hash, or Malware Processes.

operations.title: Remove Entries From Resource List
operations.description: Deletes elements from a resource list in FortiSIEM based on the resource IDs and resource type you have specified.

parameters.title: Resource IDs
parameters.name: resource_ids
parameters.tooltip: Enter list of resource IDs which you wants to delete
parameters.description: Specify the IDs of the resources you want to delete from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server.

parameters.title: Resource Type
parameters.name: resource_type
parameters.tooltip: Select Resource type
parameters.description: Select the type of resource (element) that you want to delete from the Fortinet FortiSIEM server. You can choose from the following options: Malware IP, Malware Domains, Malware Urls, Malware Hash, or Malware Processes
